message_1: What is the solubility of potassium nitrate (KNO3) at 25°C in water if the maximum amount of solute that can dissolve is 31.6 g/100 mL?
message_2:
The solubility of potassium nitrate (KNO3) at 25°C in water is given as the maximum amount of solute that can dissolve in a given amount of solvent. In this case, the maximum amount of KNO3 that can dissolve is 31.6 g in 100 mL of water.

To express the solubility, we can use the unit grams per 100 milliliters (g/100 mL). Therefore, the solubility of potassium nitrate (KNO3) at 25°C in water is 31.6 g/100 mL.
